input.command:
gh pr create --title "docs(footer): simplify copyright text" --body "$(cat <<'EOF'
## Summary
- Simplified footer copyright text by removing "All rights reserved"
- Streamlines the copyright notice for a cleaner presentation

## Changes
- Updated index.html footer paragraph to remove "All rights reserved" text

## Testing Done
- Manual review of HTML changes
- No functional changes, purely presentational

## Breaking Changes
None

ðŸ¤– Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)
EOF
)"

content.thinking:
The user has said "continue" which means they want me to proceed with merging the PR. According to the workflow, after confirmation I should:
1. Merge the PR (asking about squash or merge commit preference)
2. Verify merge was successful
3. Delete remote branch
4. Update local main
5. Confirm completion

Let me ask about merge preference first, then proceed.

content.text: I'll proceed with merging the PR. First, let me ask about your merge preference.

questions.question: How would you like to merge this pull request?

options.label: Squash and merge
options.description: Combine all commits into a single commit on main (recommended for clean history)

options.label: Merge commit
options.description: Preserve all commits and create a merge commit

**Commit Message:** docs(footer): simplify copyright text (#1)

- Created branch: `docs/simplify-footer-text`

- Deleted remote branch: `docs/simplify-footer-text`
- Updated local main branch
- Cleaned up local branches

### Changes Merged:
- Modified `index.html` - Simplified footer copyright text by removing "All rights reserved"

All steps completed successfully. Your changes are now live on the main branch!
